features: Creative connect system-Easy to build, easy to disassemble,Won't Fall Apart.Each Creative Fort building kit comes with 30 magic balls, 64 long rods and 46 extend connectors,140 Pcs totally,rich enough to create more structures. Simply insert the rods into the balls, builder connects in a few seconds. Best of all, it's light but sturdy, supports sheets well. A handy step-by-step guide shows you how to build.

Build Anything You Imagine - Our 140 Pieces magic-making set allows your child to build their very own fort such as a cave, tunnel, teepee, playhouse, space ball, igloo, castle, tent, giant rocket, and more, just add a blanket or lights to create a hideaway place to play and read! All forts are big enough for more kids to get in. Building a large and complex fort can be full of challenges and bring endless fun to kids, even parents. Excellent way to spend time with your kids.

Enjoy Creative and Build Skills - Fort building set is a construction toy for boys and girls which improves their STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) skills. Kids would focus their thoughts on creating the perfect fort, which helps to improve imagination and creativity, enhance their ability of problem-solving. It's a perfect creative toy for more children to play together so that they have the opportunity to cooperate with others and learn about teamwork.

Perfect Construction STEM Gift - Color box packing. This easy-to-build and firmly forts is an ideal educational gift for kids age 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 11 12 years old, boys and girls, at Birthday, Holiday, Halloween, Christmas, New Year, or a special day you want to surprise them. It is also an awesome engineering award for kids who love to build a fort. Building your own fort is a great indoor activity for rainy or snowy days. Perfect for family reunion,friends party and more.

Premium quality and aftersale service-Made with durable 100% safe Abs plastic. Toy set Certified Conforms to us toy safety standards ASTM F963.-Any quality issue please return it within 180 days for refund or replacement, and if you have any questions. Please contact us freely. We will reply to you within 24 hours.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great creative play for 4 and 8 year old
reviews.reviewText: We bought these for our daughter for Christmas and they’re getting lots of use for fort building so far. I wouldn’t expect kids younger than 4 to be able to manipulate the pieces as needed, though it’s going well with the help of any older sibling.One rod has broken in the first few weeks, but because our daughters were using them like swords. I.e., they’re not indestructible, but are holding up well when used as intended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars TBA. Upcoming birthday gift
reviews.reviewText: Looks fun, will promote lots of creativity. Upcoming birthday gift, we will see how easy it is to put together and how durable it really is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Needs more pieces at this price if there are two or more children over four- Sturdy though
reviews.reviewText: These are nice and sturdy and go together well. At this price I would love to have had a few more pieces to allow for two separate forts, albeit short ones rather than buy two sets which might be too much to store. Impatient kids will need adult help to build these. The dome is really too small for two kids over age four or five to both play in because it's too small for two to move around in thus defeating it's purpose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get it out your "save for later" p& make your child happy
reviews.reviewText: Awesome!!! Don't be like me& try to get it quickly& save a couple bucks at Walmart! I got a Walmart one for xmas because it was cheaper & this one wouldn't arrive until after xmas...HUGE mistake! The Walmart one has less pieces, the exact same directions but is so cheaply made it can't hold up air. This one is so sturdy we draped covers before we finished & it still held up! Fun for kids & parents to put together & build different shape forts. Skip the cheap ones & go w/ this one I promise you won't regret it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We should have had something like this long before now
reviews.reviewText: Makes fort-building super streamlined! Our kiddo loves it. Just make sure when you're putting the rods in the round connectors that you check where the arrows are and keep those sides facing up/down. (The instructions mention this) Also when doing angled roofs, make sure you're paying attention to what holes you're using in those connectors and twisting as needed to get the angles right. We use large sheets to cover the top and walls as they're a bit lighter than blankets and make it not so hot inside. The one thing this set doesn't have that I would love to see (as we needed it multiple times) are connectors with a vertical piece and then 2 to 4 horizontal pieces connected to it at NINETY DEGREE angles. For some reason all the pieces like that assume you're trying to make an octagon instead of a square so the horizontal pieces are not 90 degrees. That was the only annoying thing. Otherwise very happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great For Kids!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my nephew for his birthday, immediately after opening he had a blast the entire time.Building it in all different directions and different ways. Great interactive and building tool for children. Only downside is some of the projects on the actual instructions are very hard to construct and most you don't have enough to actually complete them. The pieces also have to be handled gentle or they break easily if you pull too hard.Other then that, an awesome gift that my nephew still uses! (Hes 5 years old)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My 2yr old(32 months) cannot do this on his own. I put this together and we had a ball. It held up pretty good but you also have to make sure you have knowledge in rocket science, mechanics or just a sturdy base. (Jk) People who have a hard time with this are using HEAVY blankets when sheets should suffice and are absolutely perfect. We give it an A!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars My daughter loves this
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and lots of different ways to play with this and it’s educational!! One flaw is one of the posts end wasn’t formed correctly and so we are down one post. Otherwise great product for an educational play!
A mi niño le gustó mucho, es fácil de armar, relativamente estable.Al desarmarlo las puezas siguen en buen estado (lo q uno espera x el precio).

Buen material, para niños mayores de 5 años es fácil de usar, niños menores definitivamente necesitan el apoyo de un adulto, y sí, se necesitan al menos 2 juegos para que el tamaño de la estructura sea adecuado
Realmente un juego muy entretenido y además le ayuda a crear más habilidades
